meanings.definition: relating to the interaction between biological and behavioral processes
meanings.sent1: The biobehavioral study focused on how genes and actions influence each other.
meanings.sent2: The researchers conducted a biobehavioral experiment to understand the connection between biology and behavior.
meanings.sent3: The biobehavioral approach to studying animals involved observing their natural instincts in different environments.
meanings.sent4: Her biobehavioral research shed light on the intricate dance between nature and nurture.
meanings.sent5: The biobehavioral model illustrated how our genes and habits shape our daily lives.

meanings.definition: involving both biological and behavioral components
meanings.sent1: The biobehavioral therapy session addressed both the physical and mental aspects of healing.
meanings.sent2: The biobehavioral approach to health considers the impact of both biology and behavior on well-being.
meanings.sent3: The biobehavioral program encouraged participants to adopt healthy habits while also understanding their body's needs.
meanings.sent4: His biobehavioral analysis highlighted the importance of considering both nature and nurture in development.
meanings.sent5: The biobehavioral perspective emphasized the interconnectedness of our biology and actions.
